items.headline: Kugler’s active stock-market trades violated Fed rules. Here’s how they performed.
items.summary_en: The stock-market trades that former Federal Reserve Gov. Adriana Kugler made while serving on the central bank’s board violated policy. At least one buy and sale was very profitable.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: First SoftBank, and now Peter Thiel dumps Nvidia position as talk of AI bubble intensifies
items.summary_en: A week after Japan’s richest man disclosed that his firm fully divested his $5.8 billion stake in Nvidia, one of America’s richest, Peter Thiel, has said he’s done the same.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘This is not a money grab’: Against our mom’s wishes, our father is leaving their estate to his church. How do we stop him?
items.summary_en: “It is about respecting our mother’s wishes.”

items.headline: U.S. stock futures inch higher as investors anxiously await Nvidia earnings
items.summary_en: U.S. stock futures were little changed on Sunday, following a choppy week on Wall Street.

items.headline: The economy survived the government shutdown — but all is not well
items.summary_en: The U.S. economy didn’t get any better during the longest government shutdown in history, but the good news is that it probably didn’t get much worse.

items.headline: Trump has bought at least $82 million in bonds since late August, disclosures show
items.summary_en: President Donald Trump purchased at least $82 million in corporate and municipal bonds between late August and early October, according to newly released disclosures.

items.headline: ‘I’m a big fan of DIY investing’: I’m 64 and moving to the U.S. I have $2.6 million, but no Social Security. Will I be OK?
items.summary_en: “Advisers do well in bull markets and poorly in bear markets, while I generally do better during downturns than the S&P 500.”
